properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 17 at 6:41PM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Storm force winds of at least 48kts will continue to threaten the
coastal waters extending 40 nautical mile from Manua through
Tuesday, as a complex environment within the active monsoon
trough keeps the possibility of a tropical cyclone developing over
or near the islands. Seas of 20 to 25 feet or higher will remain
through Tuesday, with higher seas near thunderstorms.

A storm warning means sustained winds of 48-63 kts (55-73 mph) or
greater, is either predicted or occurring, and not directly
associated with a tropical cyclone.

Storm force winds and dangerous seas could capsize or damage
vessels and the frequent showers could reduce visibility.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates.

You may also follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website
at www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Storm Warning is in effect for coastal waters extending 40 nautical miles from Manua American Samoa
